text: Keg @ Town Hall. Brilliant gold with a white head. Mellow pepper nose. Fresh baked bread. Honey. Light grass. Flavor is similar. Clean, dry, lightly aweet. Some white grape. Bread. A bit earthy. Dry finish. Light body, active carb. Good.
Draft at the source. Crystal clear pale yellow color. Aroma of white pepper and straw. Taste is dusty white pepper, clean finish.
on tap @RBSG Minni-white-pale yellow. A-lt/med fruit, grain. T-fruity/spice hops, sweet grain.

Sampled at GTMW 2013. Nice golden pour with bright white head. Aroma is crisp, bready with herbal and grassy hops. Flavor is nice, crisp, strong hop grassy hop presence. Flavor is nice, crisp with pilsner malt and crisp hops showcased well. Nice, lively carbonation, finishes on a nice pils hoppy note. Good pils.
Dract at townhall. From notes. Floral and grassy. Very light and easy drinking. Good.

Draft pour at GTMW 2013. Pours a clear gold with a small white head. Notes of pale and sweet malts, grassy and floral hops, crackers, and a bit of spice. Clean, easy-stipping, crisp and dry. Light-bodied, with medium-high carbonation. Solid pils.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 Solid Bohemian PIlsner. Dry malt and well hopped with saaz of course. Some grass and wood flavors.7 3 7 4 14  Rerate, 2/16, I liked it a little more the second time, but was surprised my numbers changed by only one point. Some hope complexity and lager yeast is noticeable.

On tap at GTMW - Pours clear golden with a thin white head. Nose is fruity, grassy floral hops and pale honey malt. Taste is pale honey malt, floral, and a bit of grassy hops. Thin and too carbonated.
July 21, 2012 on tap at All Pints North.  Clear yellow pour with head.  Grain, malt and hops in aroma and taste.  Thin to medium body.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2013 On tap at SPSBF. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates quickly to the edges. Aroma has a good amount amount of grass hops with a bit of backing grain and crisp lager yeast. Flavor is similar with a really nice balanced grassy hop note and grain backing with a nice crisp yeast note.
Sampled at St. Paul Summer Beer Fest. Golden pour, grassy hops and yeast on the aroma and taste. Good hop bite in this.

Sampled on tap at the brewpub (Minneapolis, MN). Pours a nice golden straw hue, faint haze, a small frothy brightish white head laces small, dies to a ring. Aromas are touches of grassy hops, soap, and grainy bready malts with grass. Initial is a bit sweet up front, bready and grainy malts. Touches of stinky yeasty pils malts, decent grassy and floral hops, bread, crackers, pale malts. Fairly clean, but the bitterness lingers on with a nice yeasty spice that dries out the palate. Not bad. Clean and bitter, lingering sweetness, fresh and spicy yeast do its job. A Pils with some life, fairly fresh, I could put back a few of these
Minnesota Winterfest 2011.  Crystal clear golden color with a small head.  Strong floral hop aroma.  Very grassy and floral taste.  Moderate bitterness.  Perfect.

Draft at Town Hall.  Filtered greenish yellow.  Steady white head.  Peppery hop aroma on top of a clean malt backbone.  Reclaiming all the good parts of a Pils .  Pretty big and bold, somewhere between a Bohemian Pils and an Imperial Pils.  Not at all sticky or sugary.  Impressive.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Original rating, 7-27-10: 16 oz. pour, on tap at the brewpub. Consumed on 7-26-10. Pours a clear, pale gold with a small to moderate amount of thick, off-white / eggshell head. Very Czech smell; spicy. Very dry, hoppy taste. Definitely a hops-forward pilsner atop a fruity malt background. Long, dry aftertaste. Sharp and lively in the palate. The limitations of the pilsner style make it difficult for an example to be spectacular, in my opinion, but it can be quite solid when done well, and Town Hall Saaz Pilsner is quite solid, having been done well. 7/3/7/4/14=>3.5. Re-rate, 3-28-10: 5 oz. pour, on tap at the brewpub in Minneapolis, Minnesota. Clear, pale brass. Small amount of beige head. Nice color. Weak aroma of apple. I love Saaz, but dont get enough of it in the smell. Floral, honey smell improves upon return. Pleasant, dry, hoppy flavor. Nice, dusty, chalky, bitter finish. This is how a pilsner should taste. Not overwhelming flavor but whats there is quite likable. Saaz is unmistakable in the taste. Lively and crisp in the palate. Medium body, surprisingly heavy for the ABV. East to drink and refreshing. Substantial and very good palate effects. An above average Czech pilsner. Authentic. 7/3/8/4/14=>3.6. Combined score: 7/3/7/4/14=>3.5.
On tap. Pours pale gold with small white head.  Sweet and grassy aroma.  Flavor is sweet and floral.  Nice bitter hop finish.  Refreshing beer.

Sample at brewpub.  Floral hop aroma with a pale gold color.  Pretty darn good.  Sweet pilsner malt with a slight funk and a pretty high level of bitterness to balance.  Several people in my party ordered this and it was universally appreciated.
On tap at Town Hall pours golden/straw with light head. Aroma is grassy, earthy with malts. Taste as smells malts and oats medium body slight citrus nice finish. Enjoyable.

Pours golden, with a nice lasting white head.  Aroma is grassy hops with a bit of lemon, and the taste is similar with a nice grassy hop style pilsner that rounds out with bready malt at the end.  A good pilsner.
